intro: Veronica scutellata f. villosa, commonly known as the hairy Veronica, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It features upright, slender stems covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers arranged in spikes, typically blooming from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and also bear a hairy texture, contributing to its overall rugged look. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or limestone habitats.
